uses: Used to treat pain and fever. Common for headaches, muscle aches, and colds.
side_effects: Generally safe, but high doses can cause liver damage. Nausea and rash are rare.
disclaimer: Always follow the recommended dosage. Consult a doctor if you have liver problems.

uses: A brand name for Paracetamol. Used for fever, headache, and body pain.
side_effects: Similar to Paracetamol. Can cause allergic reactions in some people.
disclaimer: Do not take more than 4 doses in 24 hours. Consult a doctor for prolonged use.

uses: Used to relieve pain from various conditions such as headache, dental pain, and menstrual cramps. Also used to reduce fever and relieve minor aches due to the common cold or flu.
side_effects: Can cause upset stomach, nausea, vomiting, headache, diarrhea, and constipation.
disclaimer: Take with food or milk to prevent stomach upset. Do not use if you have a history of stomach ulcers.

uses: An antihistamine used to relieve allergy symptoms such as watery eyes, runny nose, itching eyes/nose, and sneezing.
side_effects: Drowsiness, dry mouth, and tiredness may occur.
disclaimer: Avoid driving or operating heavy machinery until you know how this medication affects you.

uses: An antibiotic used to treat a wide variety of bacterial infections, such as chest infections (including pneumonia), dental abscesses, and urinary tract infections (UTIs).
side_effects: Nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, rash. Can cause allergic reactions.
disclaimer: Must be prescribed by a doctor. Complete the full course of treatment, even if you feel better.
